intro: Hieracium multidens, commonly known as the many-toothed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often with a distinctive central disc surrounded by ray florets. Hieracium multidens is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
